New Records: Dunith Wellalage took 5 wickets in the match, leading Sri Lanka to a 110-run victory and a 2-0 series win over India
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma top-scored for India with 35 runs
Washington Sundar's 30 runs at the end of the innings gave India some hope, but it was snuffed out by Maheesh Theekshana
Dunith Wellalage took 5 wickets, including the crucial wicket of Kuldeep Yadav, to lead Sri Lanka to victory
Shreyas Iyer was lbw for 8 runs, and Axar Patel was bowled for 2 runs, both falling to Dunith Wellalage
Virat Kohli was lbw for 20 runs, and Rishabh Pant was stumped for 6 runs, both falling to Maheesh Theekshana
Pre-Game Insights: India's Rohit Sharma said that they need to adapt to the conditions and play consistent cricket
Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka said that they want to see one of their batters score a century on this pitch
Post-Match Reflections: India's Rohit Sharma said that they were disappointed with the loss, but they will learn from it and move forward
Sri Lanka's Dunith Wellalage said that he is happy with the team's performance and that they played well as a unit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicket was dry and offered not much turn for the Indian spinners
Sri Lanka's spinners, including Maheesh Theekshana and Dunith Wellalage, bowled well to restrict India's scoring
India's batsmen struggled against the Sri Lankan spinners, with many of them getting out to poor shots
Others: The match was played on a dry and slow pitch, which favored the Sri Lankan spinners
India's middle-order batsmen, including Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer, struggled to score runs against the Sri Lankan spinners
